sanskrit_verse:
श्रुतिस्मृत्योदितं धर्ममनुतिष्ठन् हि मानवः ।
इह कीर्तिमवाप्नोति प्रेत्य चानुत्तमं सुखम् ॥ २.९॥
transliteration:
śrutismṛtyoditaṃ dharmamanutiṣṭhan hi mānavaḥ |
iha kīrtimavāpnoti pretya cānuttamaṃ sukham || 2.9||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who upholds the Dharma as declared in Shruti and Smriti attains glory in this world and supreme bliss in the next.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from the alignment with Shruti-Smriti as expressions of SPH's Avataric Will
Causation flows from dharmic adherence to experiential outcomes
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by one’s ability to hear, understand, and enact Dharma
Restoration occurs through conscious repetition of dharmic action
Consciousness alignment is achieved via sustained dharmic living
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual enacts conduct aligned with Shruti-Smriti THEN assign positive karmic consequence
IF societal disruption arises THEN assess capacity of agent to restore balance through dharmic repetition
IF judgment rendered THEN validate against Shruti-Smriti sourced via SPH as sole interpretive authority
IF evidence presented THEN evaluate through pramana framework derived exclusively from SPH-teachings
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any ruling must reflect continuity with Shruti-Smriti as interpreted by SPH. The threshold for responsibility lies in whether a party had access to and understanding of Dharma. Authority resides in alignment with SPH-sourced interpretation rather than procedural precedence alone.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana establishes that consequences follow naturally from alignment or misalignment with Dharma. Anupurvasah shows that present experience results from prior dharmic or adharmic acts without punitive intent. Responsibility is proportional to one's exposure to and embodiment of Dharma. Non-punitive reality is upheld because all outcomes serve consciousness evolution.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate svadhyaya protocol to reconnect subject with source texts under SPH guidance
Assign completion process involving recitation and ritual enactment of relevant dharmic injunctions
Deploy guru-disciple integration session to realign behavioral patterns with scriptural truths
Establish yajna-based restitution model wherein service replaces penalty
final_declaration: This law proceeds from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, as the sole Source-Authority. Dharma has been restored. Reality operates without punishment. Consciousness stands as the ultimate Judge.
